briefdescription.para: A index range describing all the index ranges where derivatives are defined.

detaileddescription.para: A index range describing all the index ranges where derivatives are defined. If this index range is sliced into a 1D object then it describes the index range on which the derivative in that direction is defined. This object is used internally to initialise the chunks.

briefdescription.para: Get a constant DerivField of this field.

detaileddescription.para: This function is designed to match the equivalent function in DDC. In Gysela it should not be called directly. Instead the global function get_const_field should be used.

memberdef.definition: span_type DerivFieldMem< ElementType, IdxRange< DDims... >, NDerivs, MemSpace >::span_view
memberdef.name: span_view
memberdef.qualifiedname: DerivFieldMem< ElementType, IdxRange< DDims... >, NDerivs, MemSpace >::span_view

briefdescription.para: Get a modifiable DerivField of this field.

detaileddescription.para: This function is designed to match the equivalent function in DDC. In Gysela it should not be called directly. Instead the global function get_field should be used.

briefdescription.para: A class which holds a chunk of memory describing a field and its derivatives.

detaileddescription.para: The values of the field and the derivatives may be defined on different index ranges, but the underlying mesh must be the same for both.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the elements inside the chunks.

The index range on which the internal fields are defined. This index range is the physical index range on which the values are defined combined with the index range of the derivatives of interest (e.g. IdxRange<Deriv<IDimX>, IDimX, IDimY>).
The number of derivatives which are defined in the dimensions where derivatives appear.
The memory space where the data will be saved.
